revised_title: Wave Set-up, Percolation, and Undertow in the Surf Zone: A Study of Coastal Water Dynamics
tldr: This study demonstrates the wave set-up phenomenon, which causes a change in the mean water level in the surf zone due to breaking waves. The wave set-up drives an offshore bottom current called the undertow and influences the inshore circulation. The research also shows that the set-up can create an internal flow or circulation of water within the beach, affecting the porosity of the beach material.
